title: 2021: The next 3-4 months are going to be worse than financial markets are braced for: Economist
text: Tim Quinlan, Wells Fargo Senior Economist weighs in on the economic outlook for 2021.

title: 3 Factors That Will Drive Stock Market In 2021
text: We believe there are going to be three key macro drivers of stock market and economy in 2021. The biggest driver of the financial markets is the path of the pandemic/vaccine, followed by the pace and trajectory of government stimulus, and China.

title: Big Tech Is In For A Reckoning: Harrison
text: As we go into 2021, the potential for Big Tech to underperform the market is high due to increasing scrutiny of anti-competitive practices amid the Facebook antitrust lawsuit.

title: S&P 500 Weekly Update: A Buying Stampede That Left The Majority Of Analysts Behind
text: There is no debate, plenty of analysts and stock market pundits got the 2020 “stock market story” horribly wrong.

title: A Review On Inflation
text: Government debt, deficit levels and central bank balance sheets are at record highs.

title: Process of Mega-IPOs Is a Travesty: Summers
text: Dec.11 -- Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers, a Wall Street Week contributor and adviser to Pres.-elect Biden's campaign, says that mega-IPOs whose shares surge on the first day of trading are evidence that Wall Street's process needs to be cleaned up. He joins David Westin on "Bloomberg Wall Street Week."

title: Soaring IPOs Can't Lift the Market. Why That's Good News.
text: An IPO frenzy is under way—rekindling memories of the tech bubble and the stock market tumble that followed.

title: Lack of Stimulus Will Cause Short-Term Turbulence: Nuveen's Malik
text: Dec.11 -- Nuveen's Head of Global Equities Saira Malik says the markets could be in for some short-term turbulence because of lack of stimulus in the U.S. And rising Covid-19 cases. She sees opportunities in emerging market equities and says Chinese assets don't look expensive yet.

title: Cramer's game plan for the trading week of Dec. 14
text: "If you want to speculate, this is the time to do it, just speculate wisely," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Cramer: Expected FDA vaccine authorization gives the market new hope
text: "This is a market that reacts positively to the obvious, so get ready because this thing is almost certain to be approved," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Cramer's week ahead: This is the time to speculate
text: "You've got my blessing to buy stocks into weakness as we move closer to the long-awaited vaccine," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: There could be profit taking once we get stimulus: Rockefeller Global's Jimmy Chang
text: Jimmy Chang, CIO of Rockefeller Global Family Office, and Susan Schmidt, Aviva Investors head of U.S. equities, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss if there is too much euphoria in the market and if investors should be nervous.

title: 9 Lessons After a Crazy Week for IPOs
text: There are still another 500 unicorns—private companies with $1 billion-plus values—waiting in the wings.

title: 2021 outlook: The path forward is higher for equities: Wealth Manager
text: Stocks closed mixed as traders watched Washington lawmakers hold at an impasse over advancing another round of virus-relief measures. US Bank Wealth Management CIO Eric Freedman and Chief Market Strategist at Truist / egistSunTrust Keith Lerner joined Yahoo Finance Live to break down the details.

title: US Indexes End Mostly Lower Friday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 30,046.37 on Friday with a gain of 47.11 points or 0.16%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,663.46 for a loss of 4.64 points or -0.13%.

title: Delisting Chinese Companies Could Be Bad For Investors. But It's the Right Thing to Do
text: Chinese companies that don't adhere to U.S. audit and accounting standards may soon be kicked of U.S. exchanges. Institutional investors have several options, but individual investors could be hurt.

title: Nasdaq to remove shares of 4 Chinese companies after U.S. order
text: Index provider Nasdaq said on Friday it will remove shares of four Chinese construction and manufacturing companies after a U.S. order restricting purchase of their shares.

title: Analysis-Amateur traders' euphoria leaves red-hot U.S. IPOs with money on the table
text: Wild stock gains on the first day of trading of Airbnb Inc and DoorDash Inc show how unprecedented demand this year from individual investors is making it difficult not to leave big money on the table, investment bankers say.

title: Equity Markets Stumble as Lawmakers Fumble on Stimulus Deal
text: U.S. equity markets were under pressure all day as lawmakers failed to come to terms on a new stimulus package.

title: What Drives the S&P PACT Indices' Weights?
text: By Ben Leale-Green, Analyst, Research & Design, ESG Indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices In April 2020, we launched the S&P PACTTM Indices (S&P Paris-Aligned & Climate Transition Indices). The indices aim to align with the following: a 1.5oC climate scenario, the relevant aspects of the EU Low Carbon Benchmark regulation (BMR), and recommendations from the Task Force on [.

title: Stock Market Today: Disney's Magic Brightens Directionless Day for Stocks
text: The stock market wobbled its way to the finish line Friday as investors continued to weigh ongoing vaccine progress against Washington's inability to reach agreement on much-needed fiscal stimulus. But Walt Disney (DIS, +13.6%) provided Wall Street with something to get excited about.

title: 'Bloomberg Real Yield': SkyBridge Capital's Troy Gayeski
text: Dec.11 -- Troy Gayeski, co-chief investment officer at SkyBridge Capital, discusses valuations, the duration trade in credit, and risk appetite. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Real Yield.

title: Goldman Sachs' Richard Ramsden: Banks have become a lot more optimistic towards 2021
text: Richard Ramsden, Goldman Sachs managing director, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss bank stocks and what he thinks could be the next catalyst for the sector.

title: There's more upside for retail with innovation happening across systems: Clearbanc's Romanow
text: Clearbanc co-founder and president Michele Romanow joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the booming e-commerce retail sector amid the pandemic. She says there's innovation happening across technological systems allowing consumers to easily purchase products online.

title: There might be a massive bond bubble that pops: Ariel Investment's Charlie Bobrinskoy
text: Charles Bobrinskoy, Ariel Investments vice chairman and head of investment group, says corporate interest rates are below inflation rates. "The high-yield market is at bubble levels, and this is not going to end well," Bobrinskoy says.

title: 2021 stock market outlook: We're very enthusiastic about the prospects for next year: Van Leeuwen
text: Founder of Van Leeuwen and Company Ken Van Leeuwen discusses the outlook for the economy and stock market.

title: US stocks end the week lower as stimulus stalemate continues
text: A continued stalemate in stimulus negotiations and the threat of a government shutdown helped push stocks lower  for the week, with the S&P 500 down by about 1%. Congress has until midnight to pass a funding bill to avert a government shutdown. The House passed a stopgap spending bill yesterday, and its now up to the Senate to pass the bill.

title: Stocks log modest weekly declines as stimulus talks stall
text: Stocks saw a mixed finish Friday, leaving major benchmarks modestly lower for the week as talks toward another round of pandemic relief spending remained stalled on Capitol Hill. The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended around 47 points higher, up 0.2%, near 30,046, according to preliminary figures, while the S&P 500 finished around 5 points lower, down 0.1%, near 3,663.

title: A Place To Invest: Underrepresented Startups
text: Two major things are happening today: the first is that the disrupted economy is providing many opportunities for people to start companies, and, two, there is lots of money around.

title: Small caps have been quietly outperforming since the bottom of this market: Strategist
text: David Nelson, Chief Strategist of Belpointe Asset Management discusses the market outlook through 2020 and 2021.

title: This Was All Predicted 10 Years Ago
text: “Quantitative historical analysis reveals that complex human societies are affected by recurrent — and predictable — waves of political instability.”.

title: It's clear that there is a rotation in the market: Icon Advisors' Craig Callahan
text: Craig Callahan, Icon Advisors president, joins CNBC's "The Exchange" to discuss the rotation in the markets. title: S&P 500 falls, heads for 3-day losing streak as stimulus uncertainty remains
text: The S&P 500 fell on Friday, on pace for its first weekly loss in three weeks, as the outlook for additional fiscal stimulus remained uncertain.

title: For the Fed, new data charts show family feuds may be a sign of health
text: Turns out, where the U.S. Federal Reserve is concerned, disagreement is a good thing.

title: Analyst Sets S&P 500 Target Of 3,900 For 2021: 'Healing Is Underway'
text: After a wild ride for the markets this yea,  the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSE: SPY) is on track to finish 2020 up 13.5% on the year. Given the ongoing pandemic, the stock market seems to be pricing in a lot of optimism about 2021, but Commonwealth Financial Network chief investment officer Brad McMillan said Friday that there's plenty of room for additional upside for the S&P 500 in 2021.

title: Stopping On The Stairs, Or?
text: Stocks are in a confirmed uptrend. But the market as become overbought and overbelieved along the way.

title: Year-end Santa rally could depend on the big week ahead for markets
text: The week ahead is so important for markets it could determine whether there will be a smooth glide path for a Santa rally into the yearend.

title: Growth could continue to outperform in short term: Global market strategist
text: Samantha Azzarello, global market strategist at J.P. Morgan Asset Management, and Ron Insana, CNBC senior analyst, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the state of the markets and whether the market rally could run out of steam.

title: Here's everything the Federal Reserve could do at its policy meeting next week
text: The Federal Reserve heads into its meeting next week in a familiar place, with a teetering economy that could be in further danger.

title: Americans increasingly see the stock market as a barometer just for the rich, not the whole economy
text: 57% of respondents said that new market highs Nasdaq meant that corporations and the wealthy were doing better, not necessarily the overall economy.

title: Market Frenzy Will Correct and End Badly, Epoch's Pearl Says
text: Dec.11 -- David Pearl, co-chief investment officer at Epoch Investment Partners, says the market has been broadening out over the last month and a half and is getting back to fundamentals. He speaks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on “Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: Moelis Says Covid-19 ‘Changed Everything' on Wall Street
text: Dec.11 -- Ken Moelis, the chairman and chief executive officer of Moelis & Co., says the Covid-19 pandemic is upending everything on Wall Street, from where people work to the need for business travel, to how companies raise capital. In this interview, he describes the long-lasting effects of the pandemic and discusses the future of his firm, including CEO succession.

title: Markets Are Pricing for Next Year, BlackRock's Watson Says
text: Dec.11 -- Marilyn Watson, head of global fundamental fixed income strategy at BlackRock, examines how stimulus and the Covid-19 vaccine play into the reflation trade and says markets are pricing in positive growth for next year. She speaks with Bloomberg's Alix Steel on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: Commodities Corner: Natural-gas prices look to end the year higher for the first time since 2016
text: Natural gas is outperforming oil in 2020, with prices now poised to do something they haven't done since 2016: finish higher for the year.

title: In One Chart: Here's a sign the stock market rally hasn't fully factored in a successful vaccine rollout
text: The rollout of COVID-19 vaccines isn't putting pandemic-related fears on the back burner for 2021, according to a monthly survey of clients by Deutsche Bank.

title: Real market response to Covid closures could come in January, strategist says
text: Shannon Saccocia, Boston Private Wealth chief investment officer, joins CNBC's "Fast Money Halftime Report" to discuss market reaction to the rising coronavirus cases and closures.

title: Household net worth hits new record of $123.5 trillion amid stock market surge
text: That's an increase of $3.8 trillion, or 3.2% from the second quarter. It's up 7.6% from the same period a year earlier.

title: Stocks See Volatile Week Amid Vaccine, Stimulus News
text: Stimulus negotiations and COVID-19 vaccine news were front and center over the past few days, taking up most headlines as they made up for a volatile week.

title: Commodities Corner: Iron ore leads gains for industrial metals, up nearly 65% this year
text: Industrial metals have proven their resilience in the face of a weakened global economy, with iron ore prices among the biggest gainers, poised to end the year with an almost 65% climb.

title: Three Factors Traders Are Watching at the Close of 2020
text: How quickly the U.S. can roll out a Covid-19 vaccine, whether jobs will rebound, and holiday spending are three things occupying every trader's thoughts as the year comes to a close.
